body:
Sorry for the confusion.
For direct filesystem access it is ok.
I mean the relative path within asar file
e.g.
app.asar has following structure
/data
/lib/cmd
/lib/cmd/a.js

the wrapped file system:
fs.lstat("app.asar/lib/cmd/",cb); //returns false / not found
fs.lstat("app.asar/lib/cmd",cb); //returns directory

the original filesystem always return directory no matter it is with or
without the trailing slash.

~Keyang

On 16 July 2015 at 09:48, Cheng Zhao notifications@github.com wrote:

> Any test code? Following code works well:

> var fs = require('fs');var originalFs = require('original-fs');var assert = require('assert');
> 
> assert.deepEqual(fs.lstatSync('/tmp'), originalFs.lstatSync('/tmp'));
> assert.deepEqual(fs.lstatSync('/tmp/'), originalFs.lstatSync('/tmp/'));
